page.title: 04SHIREBROOK COLLIERY cont'd
page.content: Q. Do men have to serve an apprenticeship before being allowed underground? A. Yes. Men under 18 years go to a special training centre for 4 weeks. They then work on the surface for 4 weeks with a supervisor, then work underground for a further 4 weeks with the supervisor. Men who are over 18 just train for 4 weeks underground with a supervisor. Q. For how long does the pit manager think the coal seams will last ? A. 25 years. Q. Does the coal have to be sorted out before it is taken to houses and other places? A. Yes. That happens at the pit top.
